intro: Clethra papuana var. trichostyla, commonly known as the Papuan clethra, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a leathery texture, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
